image.altText: A young white woman in a wheelchair out on the street

props.synopsis: The role of special schools is again in the spotlight, with the disability royal commission recommending segregated education be phased out.

title.children: Australia has long been divided on 'special schools'. Now the disability royal commission is too

image.altText: GettyImages-1711178312

props.synopsis: Panthers star Nathan Cleary has scored a stunning late try to give Penrith their third premiership in a row, after Broncos young gun Ezra Mam earlier scored three tries. Follow live.

title.children: Late Cleary magic concludes stunning Panthers comeback over Broncos to claim third NRL premiership in a row

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What a truly phenomenal comeback by this unbelievable team. It was 24-8 when Ezra Mam scored his third try in the 54th minute. And still it felt like the Broncos had given them too much time. And so it proved. Even, actually especially, with Jarome Luai sidelined by injury and Isaah Yeo, Nathan Cleary grabbed this time by the scruff of the neck and said "come with me" to triple premiership glory. The Brisbane Broncos are on the wrong side of yet another heartbreaker in yet another one of the greatest grand finals ever that they absolutely will never want to hear about again.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: THE PENRITH PANTHERS ARE THREE-TIME NRL PREMIERS!!!

children.content: What a truly phenomenal comeback by this unbelievable team.
It was 24-8 when Ezra Mam scored his third try in the 54th minute. And still it felt like the Broncos had given them too much time.
Even, actually especially, with Jarome Luai sidelined by injury and Isaah Yeo, Nathan Cleary grabbed this time by the scruff of the neck and said "come with me" to triple premiership glory.
The Brisbane Broncos are on the wrong side of yet another heartbreaker in yet another one of the greatest grand finals ever that they absolutely will never want to hear about again.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: There was nothing happening when the ball went to the short side, but he stood up his opposite number Adam Reynolds, then Billy Walters, then Reece Walsh to dot down under the posts. Nathan Cleary will convert from right in front of the uprights. Penrith are in front 26-24 with less than two minutes to play.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: NATHAN CLEARY IS THE HERO FOR PENRITH!!!

children.content: There was nothing happening when the ball went to the short side, but he stood up his opposite number Adam Reynolds, then Billy Walters, then Reece Walsh to dot down under the posts.
Nathan Cleary will convert from right in front of the uprights.
Penrith are in front 26-24 with less than two minutes to play.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Speed and power from the Penrith centre, getting outside Kotoni Staggs, holding him off and finishing through an admittedly poor cover tackle from Reece Walsh. Nathan Cleary converts. The Broncos still lead, but it's squeaky bum time at 24-20.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: STEPHEN CRICHTON IS IN!! THE COMEBACK IS ON!!!

children.content: Speed and power from the Penrith centre, getting outside Kotoni Staggs, holding him off and finishing through an admittedly poor cover tackle from Reece Walsh.
Nathan Cleary converts. The Broncos still lead, but it's squeaky bum time at 24-20.

image.altText: A Queensland ambulance on a busy city street

props.synopsis: A sixth person has died and several more are injured after multiple serious traffic crashes on Queensland roads over the final weekend of the school holidays.

title.children: Six dead in horror weekend on Queensland roads

image.altText: The Mackay Base Hospital seen from an airplane window

props.synopsis: Thousands of Queensland Health workers will be able to anonymously escalate patient safety concerns to a hotline as part of a pilot project promised a year ago.

title.children: Hotline to allow health workers to anonymously escalate patient safety concerns

image.altText: Jude is selling her shop

props.synopsis: Fishing icon Judey Aiken has a mouth that could make a sailor blush, but it's her warm heart and boisterous nature that's made her known across the country.

title.children: 'Rude Jude' hands over her naughty bait and tackle shop that has tickled tourists and locals alike for decades

props.synopsis: Local residents say they heard the sound of a whale crying out early this morning before a calf was released from a shark net.

title.children: Sound of trapped humpback whale calf heard across Sunshine Coast suburb before rescue

image.altText: Scene of car crash with investigators under a tent near a crashed truck and car near bush on side of road

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police have confirmed six people died in a head-on crash involving a road train and four-wheel drive on the Stuart Highway.

title.children: Six people killed in Northern Territory's deadliest road crash in 16 years, police say

image.altText: A crocodile and a Chinook helicopter.

props.synopsis: Crocs at a Rockhampton reptile farm were flung into the throes of orgiastic ecstasy after a Chinook helicopter hovered low over their pools – and the erotic explosion has researchers very interested.

title.children: Croc sex frenzy: Low-flying army choppers spark romp in the swamp

image.altText: Distraught Brisbane Lions players stand and sit on the ground at the MCG after the end of the grand final.

props.synopsis: There is no dishonour for the Brisbane Lions in losing one of the great grand finals, but there are no guarantees in football. So, where to now for the team and coach Chris Fagan?

title.children: Brisbane Lions at the crossroads after grand final heartbreak

image.altText: Jordie van den Berg leaning against a red brick wall smiling at his phone.

props.synopsis: Jordie van den Berg, a 27-year-old trained lawyer, is working to turn the tables on landlords and real estate agents with a website featuring more 1,500 reviews of rental properties and owners.

title.children: Black mould and exposed asbestos: Meet the TikToker giving a voice to renters

image.altText: A woman elevated above a crowd of people looking excited with hands in the air

props.synopsis: After attracting record crowds, the Australian leg of the Listen Out festival has come to to a close with performances in Sydney including by ONEFOUR.

title.children: Listen Out festival sees heavy police presence, tens of thousands of revellers and changes to line-up

image.altText: A man surfing.

props.synopsis: Novel new materials and methods developed and manufactured in Australia are turning basalt and recycled plastic into high performance, environmentally-friendly surfboards.

title.children: How volcanic rock is turned into cutting-edge surfboard tech

image.altText: Large crowd at music festival

props.synopsis: Two men in their 20s have died after attending the Knockout Outdoor festival, while nine urgent medical transfers were made from Listen Out festival at Centennial Park.

title.children: 'It's horrible': Two people dead after attending Knockout Outdoor music festival in Sydney

image.altText: A woman in traditional Uyghur garb poses for a photo

props.synopsis: For several years, the region of Xinjiang has been shut off from most of the world's media. The ABC got to go inside, but all was not as it seemed.

title.children: China gave the ABC a tightly controlled tour of Xinjiang. Here's what we saw

image.altText: A mum laying in a hospital bed in blue hospital robes feeding a bottle of milk to a baby

props.synopsis: While there is no cure for breast cancer, experts say medical advances are allowing patients to live longer and enjoy a better quality of life.

title.children: Diagnosed with breast cancer at 33, Elysia is pinning her hopes on a drug so new, it doesn't have a name

image.altText: A graphic with a chook to the left and young girl carrying a chook to the right.

props.synopsis: Every morning, Naomi walks her chook Mavis around the footpaths of south-east Queensland, drawing looks of disbelief and starting conversations along the way.

title.children: How a daily walk made Mavis the 'sassy' pet chook a hit in her neighbourhood

image.altText: A seated Elise Archer looks upwards.

props.synopsis: The rift between Tasmania's former attorney-general Elise Archer and Liberal leader Jeremy Rockliff is deepening, with Ms Archer saying a leaked message in which she appears to criticise victim-survivors of child sexual abuse was taken out of context — and used in an attempt to smear her.

title.children: Archer says 'sick of victim-survivors' message taken out of context, part of Liberals smear campaign

image.altText: composite image of jennifer cownie and maggie zhou

props.synopsis: Being busy has become the symbol of modern life. And for many, living a fast-paced lifestyle is aspirational.

title.children: 'Not everyone wants to be busy': Why the 'snail girl era' resonates

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese walk in a court yard at parliament house with coffees

props.synopsis: The government has a new definition of full employment, but will it make any difference, asks Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Is the Albanese government's vision of full employment a flop?

image.altText: McIlroy

props.synopsis: The European team's four-time Major winner explodes into a heated argument at the Ryder Cup, after claiming an opponent's caddie was waving his hat during a crucial putt.

title.children: Explosive scenes at the Ryder Cup as Rory McIlroy accuses opponent's caddie of unfair play

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

props.synopsis: About 400 Australian aerospace support workers are facing redundancy after a fleet of MRH90 Taipan helicopters has been retired early, the head of the European manufacturer says.

title.children: Retiring Australia's Taipan helicopters will cost 400 local jobs, manufacturer says

image.altText: Ken, on the left, and Louis, on the right, wearing white clothes covered in bright colours after doing a colour run

props.synopsis: When Ken turned 94 in July, there was one birthday card that stood out to him — it was written by a teenager he met in a social experiment who he now counts as a close friend.

title.children: Despite a 78-year age gap, Ken and Louis connected over their shared grief. Now they're firm friends

image.altText: Colourful pencils on a desk in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: Australian parents facing crippling cost-of-living pressures are paying almost twice the OECD average for child care, an ACCC inquiry finds, with the system also failing to deliver for low-income families and those in the bush.

title.children: Australia's for-profit childcare system favours the wealthy and needs a major re-design: ACCC

image.altText: A composite image of a man walking in the rain, of a sunset, and of rain falling over a bay.

props.synopsis: From record-breaking spring heat over south-eastern Australia to flooding rains in Greece and Spain, the jet stream has had a lot to answer for recently. Here's what it is and how it works.

title.children: 'Arguably the greatest weather systems on Earth': How the jet stream has been driving extreme weather

image.altText: a group of people strolling outdoors in Sydney along a footpath as a woman pushes a pram and a man jogs

props.synopsis: This September will go down as the hottest and driest on record in parts of Australia. But after another hot weekend will come a significant drenching, explains ABC meteorologist Tom Saunders.

title.children: It's hot again — but a clash between Antarctica and the tropics is set to bring a drenching next week

image.altText: A man dives through the air before scoring a try.

props.synopsis: Australia's World Cup hopes remain alive after Fiji fails to secure a bonus point in their victory over Georgia.

title.children: Wallabies still alive at Rugby World Cup as Fiji scrapes home against Georgia

image.altText: A composite image of pancakes with strawberries and cream, and Trevor Braun holding strawberries and cream with chocolate sauce.

props.synopsis: Trevor Braun was struggling to feed his family during a devastating drought, so he decided to sell the family farm to focus on selling sweet treats.

title.children: Farmers walk away from drought, distress to celebrate sweet food van success

image.altText: A boy holding a painted surfboard with the ocean behind him.

props.synopsis: Offshore wind zones are being established right around Australia, but some communities say there are too many unknown risks.

title.children: Offshore wind touted as possible energy solution, but some young Aussies don’t want them in their backyard

image.altText: Collingwood coach Craig McRae pumps his right fist after winning the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: As the Magpies celebrated their epic premiership victory, Craig McRae announced to the massive MCG crowd his wife has given birth to a baby girl.

title.children: 'Best day of my life': Magpies coach reveals stunning family news during euphoria of grand final win

image.altText: Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas attend the gala

props.synopsis: As the messy break-up between Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas plays out in full view of the public, social media is exposing the radically shifting power dynamics of the celebrity divorce industrial complex.

title.children: Joe Jonas, Sophie Turner and the shifting dynamics of the celebrity divorce industrial complex

image.altText: A brown bear hunts for salmon, before winter hibernation, in a river.

props.synopsis: They are big, round, fluffy and want your vote. Here is everything you need to know about Fat Bear Week.

title.children: Bigger is better as voters get ready for Fat Bear Week
